summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 18114, entitled, "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Bellevue Place, from East Roy Street to Bellevue Avenue North, and Bellevue Court, from Bellevue Place to Belmont Avenue North, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, and constructing concrete walks thereon, and providing for the necessary drainage connections to the existing improvements, all in accordance with Resolution No. 1104 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved on the twenty-third day of March, 1908.
